TextBody:
Hi Mike,
 
Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support.
If it's a NetApp hosted in Azure, your expertise in ensuring open ports and valid credentials is crucial for its functionality.
You might have to update the Fpolicy if the SVM's or anything changes.
If you don't have access to the NetApp appliance, how would you give Activity Monitor access to it?
 
Thanks,


Frantz Jean Baptiste
Technical Support T1
Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

Cybersecurity That Works for You

Subject: Support for NetAPP running in Azure?    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BehzB:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BehzB:ref

Hi Franz, from your questions below it sounds like Netwrix doesn’t have any experience tracking file system activity on a Microsoft managed Netapp appliance running in Azure.
Is that accurate?

Also, are you able to tell me who my account manager is?

Thank You
Mike

TextBody:
Hi Mike,
 
Sorry for the late reply.
 
Ian Brady is your   account manager
Ian.brady@netwrix.com
 
It might work Depending on the NetApp type you are planning to use.
There are different flavors of NetApp in Azure:
 
NetApp Cloud Volumes ONTAP (Cloud Volumes ONTAP for Azure – Azure CVO | NetApp).
 
Azure NetApp Files ( https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/products/netapp).
Last time we checked, it didn't support the FPolicy protocol (the protocol we use for
The last time we checked, it didn't support the FPolicy protocol (the protocol we use for activity collection).
 
Please reply to this email with clarification on the type of NetApp you will use.
 
 
Thanks


Frantz Jean Baptiste
Technical Support T1
Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749

This ticket can be closed.
